column5: I normally fish the last week of June. this year we have switched to the last of July so my son can go. I fish out of Evergreen. I realize last year was different. My question- where will I find fish on this section. I don't want to go as far as McKensize bay. any help would be appreciated.

I normally fish the last week of June. this year we have switched to the last of July so my son can go. I fish out of Evergreen. I realize last year was different. My question- where will I find fish on this section. I don't want to go as far as McKensize bay. any help would be appreciated.
Cox Island and small islands around it, Steamboat. Probably many of the same places you fished in late June, only a little deeper.
Cox Island and small islands around it, Steamboat. Probably many of the same places you fished in late June, only a little deeper.
you can limit out under the train bridge..took the evergreen hottie for an evening fish.tied to the bridge and threw small jig and minnow in the current..had a blast until the lightning came..jiggy

Ditto on fishing under the railroad bridge, especially if the weather is bad/windy!!! Also, try entrance to Steamboat narrows jigging with a minnow, and far west shore line of Steamboat bay down by the point east of Farewell bay trolling the points of the shoreline with spinners. If you find a "hot spot" the anchor and jig especially by the far point where it drops off fast....:)
Both the bridge and Stmbt Nrws are better a month later, (end of August), whatever, both are in the "flight" path and tons of boats go through both areas so try to stay off to the side.
